intro: Stegnogramma gymnocarpa subsp. amabilis, commonly known as the sweet false ivy, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing, trailing shrub characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually gland-dotted. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with white petals and prominent yellow stamens, which bloom in spring. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that split open to release seeds. This species is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
